title: Supermarket Supervisor Job at Abuja’s Favourite Supermarket
content:
Abuja’s Favourite Supermarket - We’re your neighborhood supermarket, offering fresh produce, quality groceries, household essentials, and unbeatable deals—all under one roof. Located in the heart of Abuja, we’re here to make your everyday shopping easy, affordable, and enjoyable.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supermarket Supervisor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a committed and disciplined Supermarket Supervisor to provide strong leadership and hands-on supervision to our cashiers and sales attendants.
	The ideal candidate should be passionate about enforcing high standards of staff behavior, ensuring teamwork, and creating a positive, customer-friendly atmosphere while supporting smooth store operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate the activities of cashiers, sales attendants, and other front-line staff to ensure discipline, professionalism, and excellent customer service at all times.
	Set clear expectations for staff behavior, punctuality, grooming, and work ethics, and ensure compliance with company policies.
	Ensure shelves are properly stocked, displays are neat, and the sales floor is clean and organized.
	Oversee cash handling processes, monitor point-of-sale activities, and ensure accuracy in transactions.
	Monitor inventory levels, assist in restocking, and support periodic stock counts.
	Address customer complaints promptly and professionally, ensuring customer satisfaction.
	Collaborate with the branch manager to meet sales targets and implement store policies effectively.


Qualifications & Experience


	Minimum of OND, HND, or B.Sc. in any field.
	Experience in a supervisory role within a supermarket or retail setting is preferred
	Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities.
	Strong leadership skills with the ability to correct, discipline, and motivate team members.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and conflict resolution skills.
	Honest, proactive, and results-oriented.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: supermarketabuja@gmail.com using "Supermarket Supervisor - Abuja" as the subject of the mail.

title: Customer Service / Shipping Manager Job at Dangote Group
content:
Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service / Shipping Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Purpose Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Customer Service/Shipping Manager ensures that shipping operations at the Refinery run smoothly, contributing to timely and cost-effective movement of refined products, thereby supporting DPRP's operational efficiency.
	In addition, the Customer Service Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing the customer service function.
	This role includes ensuring customer satisfaction, handling customer inquiries, resolving issues, and maintaining strong relationships with clients.


Duties and Responsibilities
Shipping Operations Management:


	Coordinate all shipping activities, including vessel scheduling, berthing arrangements, and cargo documentation in compliance with company policies
	Ensure timely dispatch and receipt of cargoes, adhering to operational deadlines.
	Monitor and document all shipping activities
	Monitor vessel movement pre-and post loading


Customer Service:


	Manage and lead the customer service team to ensure high levels of service delivery.
	Coordinate with other departments to ensure seamless service and communication.
	Monitor and analyze customer service metrics to identify areas for improvement.
	Develop and implement customer service policies, procedures, and standards.
	Handle customer inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner.
	Train and mentor customer service staff to maintain high performance and motivation.
	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and transactions.
	Address and resolve any issues related to shipping delays, damages, or discrepancies.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Maritime Studies, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 7 years of experience in shipping operations /customer service or a similar role within the Petroleum/Maritime industry.
	Strong knowledge of vessel clearance processes, maritime regulations, and port operations.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Proficiency in shipping software and logistics management and/or customer service software and tools.
	Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong leadership and team management skills.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to handle high-pressure situations and resolve conflicts effectively.
	 Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Knowledge of the oil and gas industry and its customer service requirements

title: Human Resource (HR) Manager Job at Staff Line Consulting
content:
Staff Line Consulting is a consulting firm based in Lagos, Nigeria, specializing in providing professional human resource solutions and advisory services to businesses and organizations in the region.The company is committed to helping clients achieve their HR and organizational goals through tailored consulting services and industry expertise.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource (HR) Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Staff Line Consulting is recruiting on behalf of a reputable company to fill the position of an experienced and proactive HR Manager.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the company’s human resources operations, ensuring strategic alignment between HR initiatives and business goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and procedures
	Handle talent acquisition, onboarding, and employee engagement
	Manage performance appraisal systems and staff development plans
	Ensure compliance with labor laws and internal HR standards
	Maintain accurate employee records and prepare HR reports


Requirements


	Degree or certification in Human Resource Management or a related field.
	Proven experience as an HR Manager or similar senior HR role
	In-depth knowledge of Nigerian labor laws and HR best practices
	Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills
	High level of integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality


Salary
Open to Negotiation

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: Info@stafflinenigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	This recruitment is being handled by Staff Line Consulting on behalf of our client.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: IT Operations Specialist Job at AMS Finance & Management
content:
AMS Finance & Management is a financial services company, providing top-notch investment and financial solutions to our clients including individuals, corporations, and the government. We are licensed with, and regulated by the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) We are equipped with a shrewd team of professionals, who are proactively prepared to provide our clients with top-tier services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Operations Specialist

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary 
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The IT Operations Specialist is responsible for overseeing the development, implementation, and maintenance of all technology systems and infrastructure within the company. This includes ensuring the security, reliability, and scalability of IT services to support the company’s financial operations, compliance requirements, and business goals.
	The role requires strategic leadership, technical expertise, and strong alignment with regulatory standards and innovation trends in financial services.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and execute the company's IT strategy in alignment with business goals.
	Drive digital transformation initiatives, including automation and cloud adoption.
	Recommend and implement new technologies to enhance efficiency and security.
	Oversee day-to-day operations of IT systems including core banking software, ERP, CRM, and telecommunication tools.
	Ensure 99.9% uptime of systems and manage data backups and recovery procedures.
	Supervise the development and maintenance of the company's website and digital platforms.
	Implement and enforce IT security protocols to protect company and customer data.
	Ensure compliance with CBN and other regulatory standards.
	Conduct regular IT audits, risk assessments, and vulnerability testing.
	Lead the IT team, including technicians and support staff.
	Supervise IT technicians with a strong understanding of website development, graphic design, and social media platforms.
	Manage relationships with software vendors and service providers.
	Manage company-wide IT projects from conception to execution.
	Provide technical support for cross-functional projects and departmental needs.
	Analyze IT performance and present reports to executive leadership.


Requirements 


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
	Minimum of 4–6 years of experience in IT, with at least 3 years in leadership role in the financial sector.
	Proven knowledge of banking systems, infrastructure management, ERP, CRM, cloud services, and information security.
	Strong understanding of web development (HTML, WordPress, CMS), graphic design tools, and branding elements.
	Relevant certifications (CISM, CISSP, PMP, ITIL, etc.) are highly desirable.


Key Skills:


	Strategic thinking & innovation
	Leadership & cross-functional collaboration
	Website development & graphic design oversight
	Cybersecurity & compliance knowledge
	Excellent communication & stakeholder engagement.


What We Offer 


	A performance-driven culture with career growth opportunities
	Opportunity to lead digital transformation in a dynamic finance company
	Competitive salary and benefits package.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@amsfinanceltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
